answers: Additional Booster is extra help or support given by iStart if your startup performs well, like more funding, mentorship, or visibility.

The "Additional Booster" is extra support offered to select startups under iStart Rajasthan. It provides added benefits or funding based on performance and eligibility criteria to further accelerate your growth.
Additional Booster is an extra push given to high-potential startups through extended support like funding top-ups, exclusive resources, or continued mentoring under special provisions.
Extra rewards for startups that do really well - like bonus money or special recognition.
A booster refers to extra help provided to strong startups—such as additional funding, expedited support, or specialized guidance — to help them grow rapidly.
In iStart Rajasthan, "Booster" schemes refer to special incentives or support mechanisms like funding, mentorship, or business services provided to startups to give them a growth push.
Booster programs are initiatives under iStart designed to accelerate the startup’s journey by providing focused support, be it funding, recognition, or fast-track access to services.
Quick help given to startups when they need a push to grow faster.
Performance Booster is extra money or support given by iStart if your startup is doing well, like growing fast, getting a better QRate, or hiring more people.

The "Performance Booster" is an initiative under iStart Rajasthan to reward and support startups that show strong performance, growth potential, or impact. It could include funding, recognition, or resources to scale.
This booster rewards startups that have shown measurable progress or innovation with special incentives like increased funding slabs, media visibility, or advanced incubation benefits.
Special bonus for startups that hit their targets and show good results.
Employment Booster is extra support given to startups that create more jobs, especially for youth, women, or in rural areas.

The "Employment Booster" is a support given to startups that create jobs and contribute to employment generation in Rajasthan. Startups hiring local talent may become eligible for special benefits under this booster.
If your startup is generating jobs, especially for local youth, you may be eligible for Employment Booster incentives, encouraging inclusive growth and economic development.
Extra benefits for startups that hire more people and create jobs.
Thrust Booster is a special support given to startups working in important focus areas like health, education, agriculture, or the environment.
The "Thrust Booster" focuses on priority sectors or high-potential startups. It is meant to give a strategic push through sector-specific incentives, exposure, or funding support.
Thrust Boosters are targeted at startups working in key or emerging sectors. These startups receive priority access to sector-specific mentors, funding, and networking platforms.
Extra benefits for startups that hire more people and create jobs.
Investment means giving money to a business to help it grow, usually in return for a share (equity) or profit later.

iStart Rajasthan facilitates funding opportunities for startups through government support, investor connections, pitch events, and access to angel networks and VCs. You can also explore AIF and other funding avenues within the program.
iStart acts as a bridge between startups and investors, helping you become investor-ready and connecting you to opportunities ranging from seed capital to growth-stage investments.
Money and support given to startups at different stages to help them grow.

AIF stands for Alternative Investment Fund.
 It is a pool of money collected from investors and used to invest in startups, real estate, or other special projects.

AIF stands for Alternative Investment Fund. Under iStart, AIFs are used to channel investments into promising startups in Rajasthan. These funds are regulated and can offer capital through equity or quasi-equity instruments.
Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs) are professionally managed funds that invest in startups through equity or debt instruments. iStart helps startups tap into these structured funding routes.
Special funds that collect money from many investors to help promising startups.
Intellectual Property (IP) means your original ideas, creations, or inventions—like a logo, app design, product, or brand name—that you legally own.

It seems you meant “Intellectual Property.” iStart supports startups in protecting their intellectual property through awareness, expert help, and sometimes financial support for filing patents, trademarks, etc.
Protecting your innovation is important. iStart helps startups understand, file, and manage intellectual property rights like patents, trademarks, and copyrights through expert support.
Help to protect your ideas and inventions so no one can steal them.
Quality means how good, useful, and reliable a product or service is.

Quality improvement is encouraged in iStart through various mentoring programs, workshops, and certifications. Startups are guided on how to meet industry standards and improve their product or service offerings.
iStart encourages startups to focus on quality by offering access to technical mentors, industry standards training, and support for implementing quality frameworks in operations.
Making sure your product or service is good and meets the right standards.
Certification is an official proof that something (like a product, person, or company) meets certain rules or standards.

iStart Rajasthan may assist startups in obtaining certifications (like ISO, FSSAI, etc.), which are crucial for credibility and market access. Some costs for certification might be reimbursed depending on the scheme.
Getting certified helps build trust and market access. iStart may guide or assist you with obtaining key business certifications like ISO, BIS, or FSSAI, depending on your sector.
Getting official stamps that prove your business follows the right rules.
Infrastructure means the basic physical things needed to run a place or business, like roads, buildings, electricity, internet, and offices.
iStart Rajasthan provides access to co-working spaces, incubation centers, and startup-friendly infrastructure across the state to help you build and grow your business in a supportive environment.
iStart gives startups access to top-tier infrastructure—co-working hubs, labs, and incubators—across Rajasthan, providing a supportive physical and digital workspace.
Good workspaces, internet, and equipment provided to help startups work better.
Networking means meeting and connecting with people who can help your business, like investors, mentors, other startups, or customers.
iStart facilitates networking through events, meetups, pitch sessions, and startup expos—connecting you with mentors, investors, industry leaders, and fellow entrepreneurs.
Building connections is key to growth. iStart hosts startup expos, demo days, and virtual meets to help you connect with investors, mentors, and other founders.
Events and meetings where you can meet helpful people for your business.
Exemptions mean you don’t have to follow certain rules or pay some fees or taxes for a limited time. Startups under iStart may get tax exemptions or relaxed rules to help them grow easily.
Startups under iStart Rajasthan may be eligible for various government exemptions like filing fee waivers, tax relaxations, or regulatory benefits, depending on the policy provisions.
Startups registered under iStart may benefit from fee waivers, tax rebates, and regulatory relaxations to help reduce early-stage operational costs.
Special permission to skip some rules or fees to make things easier for startups.
Exposure means your startup gets seen or noticed by more people, like investors, customers, or media.
The program gives startups valuable exposure through exhibitions, national/international events, media coverage, and investor demos, helping you gain visibility and attract growth opportunities.
From media coverage to startup fairs, iStart helps you gain visibility among potential investors, partners, and customers at local, national, and international levels.
Help to make your startup famous and get noticed by more people.
Infosys, Tata, and Reliance are corporate companies.
iStart promotes collaboration between startups and large corporate partners for business development, funding, or pilot projects—opening doors for real-world implementation and scaling.
iStart fosters corporate-startup collaborations where enterprises can act as early adopters, partners, or investors, opening doors to pilots and commercial deals.
Big companies that can help startups by buying their products or working together.
A venture is a new business or project, usually started with an idea, some risk, and the hope of earning a profit.
Venture funding is supported through pitch sessions, introductions to VCs, and possible facilitation of investments through AIFs and government-recognized funds within the iStart ecosystem.
iStart helps turn ideas into ventures by supporting every phase of the startup lifecycle—from ideation and prototyping to fundraising and scaling.
Complete support for your business idea from start to success.
A Venture Capitalist (VC) is a person or company that gives money to startups with big growth potential, in return for a share in the business.
A venture capitalist (VC) is an investor who provides capital (money) to startups and small businesses that have high growth potential in exchange for equity (ownership) in the company.
Through curated pitch days and investor connects, iStart offers startups direct access to venture capital firms actively seeking to fund early-stage innovation.
Rich people or companies that invest big money in startups they believe will succeed.
A partnership is a type of business where two or more people work together, share the work, and divide the profit or loss.
iStart Rajasthan encourages partnerships with academic institutions, corporates, and government departments to help startups innovate, pilot, and scale faster through strategic collaborations.
Strategic partnerships with academic institutions, corporations, and government entities are encouraged by iStart to give startups more collaboration and commercialization pathways.
Working together with other companies or organizations to grow faster.
Talent means a natural skill or ability to do something well, like coding, designing, speaking, or solving problems.
iStart supports startups in hiring skilled talent by promoting job opportunities on its portal, hosting job fairs, and enabling collaborations with academic institutions across Rajasthan.
iStart connects startups with skilled professionals through job fairs, intern programs, and university tie-ups—helping you find the right people for your team.
Help to find skilled people to work in your startup team.
Legal right to protect your invention so others can’t copy it.
Startups under iStart can receive guidance and sometimes financial assistance for patent filing, helping you protect your innovations and secure intellectual property rights.
iStart can help you navigate the patenting process—providing legal guidance, subsidized filing support, and expert advice to protect your innovation.
Legal protection for your invention so others can't copy it without permission.
Getting guidance and advice from an expert to grow your startup.
iStart offers expert-led mentoring programs, one-on-one sessions, and advisory panels that guide startups in business strategy, product development, legal matters, and funding.
Experienced mentors from various industries are available through iStart to guide you in areas like business development, funding strategy, legal issues, and market entry.
Learning from experienced people who guide you and share their knowledge.
Learning new or better skills to improve your work.
The program supports upskilling through workshops, webinars, and training sessions that focus on entrepreneurship, leadership, technology, and industry-specific skills.
Need to strengthen your team? iStart organizes upskilling bootcamps and learning modules to enhance your business, tech, and leadership capabilities.
Learning new skills to become better at your job or business.
Your ability or talent to do a specific task well.
Things you are good at doing, like writing, designing, coding, etc.
iStart supports skill development through training programs, mentorship, and workshops to help entrepreneurs and startup teams improve business, technical, and leadership skills.
Training programs to help you learn what you need to run a successful startup.
People who promote a program or brand in schools, colleges, or online.
A way to spread awareness where selected people promote a program in their area or online.
The iStart Ambassador Program engages successful entrepreneurs, professionals, and ecosystem enablers to promote and support startups across Rajasthan by mentoring and guiding early-stage founders.
Successful people who help promote and support new startups in their area.
When the government or companies buy products/services from startups.
The process where the government or companies buy goods/services from vendors or startups.
iStart helps startups explore government procurement opportunities through policies that promote startup participation in public tenders, often with exemptions and relaxed criteria.
Special chances for startups to sell their products to the government.
Checking and judging the quality or progress of something.
To check and measure how well something is done.

Startups applying under iStart are evaluated on innovation, scalability, business model, and team strength. This evaluation helps in ranking startups and determining eligibility for grants or incubation.
Fair judging process to decide which startups get support or funding.
A person chosen or named to represent or receive something.
A person who is chosen to receive or take responsibility for something.
A "Nominee" in the context of iStart could refer to a startup or individual nominated for awards, grants, or special recognition under various startup initiatives or competitions.
Someone chosen for special awards or programs because they're doing well.
Free money given by the government to support your startup (no need to return).
Free financial help (not a loan) is given to support a business or idea.
iStart Rajasthan offers financial grants under different categories like Ideation, MVP, or Acceleration stages to support the startup journey, especially for innovative, scalable ideas.
Free money given to startups that they don't have to pay back.
The very early stage of a startup, before earning money or getting big funding.
The first stage of a startup is before you build your product or get customers.
Pre-seed support refers to early-stage financial assistance, mentoring, and infrastructure for startups that are still refining their product or idea before generating revenue.
Very early help when you're just starting with your business idea.
Total money earned by selling your product or service.
The total income a business makes before removing any costs.
Startups are encouraged to track and report their revenue through the iStart platform. Revenue growth is a key performance indicator in startup evaluations for funding and exposure opportunities.
Tools and advice to help your startup make more money from sales.
An online marketplace to sell or buy products, often run by government/startup portals.
An online market where products or services are listed and sold digitally.
The iStart eBazar is an online platform where Rajasthan-based startups can showcase and sell their products to customers and businesses, boosting local sales and brand recognition.
Online shop where Rajasthan startups can sell their products to customers.
Another word for business or company.
A word for a business, especially one that is growing or has big plans.
iStart supports micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) and startups in building sustainable enterprises with access to funding, mentoring, infrastructure, and government linkages.
Support to build a strong, long-lasting business that can grow big.
Total sales or income of a company in one year.
The total amount of money made by a company in one year from sales.

Annual turnover is an important metric used to determine startup stage, eligibility for grants, and compliance in iStart and related schemes. Startups must report this accurately during registration or evaluation.
Tracking how much money your startup makes each year to see growth.
A person or group who is affected by or interested in a business (e.g. customer, founder, investor).
Anyone who has an interest or role in a business (e.g., employees, investors, users).
Stakeholders in the iStart ecosystem include startups, incubators, government bodies, investors, mentors, and academic institutions, working together to build a thriving startup culture in Rajasthan.
All the people involved in making the startup ecosystem work together.
Short for Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming, Comics, and Extended Reality (like AR/VR)—a creative tech field.
Industries that work in animation, games, visual effects, comics, and virtual/augmented reality.
AVGC-XR (Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming, Comics & Extended Reality) is a key focus sector for iStart. Startups in this domain receive special attention, support, and infrastructure access.
Special support for startups making games, animations, and virtual reality.
Short training programs to learn or improve skills.
Hands-on learning sessions where people practice and learn new things in a short time.
iStart conducts workshops across various domains such as funding, business planning, branding, technology, legal compliance, and more to help startups grow and stay updated.
Short classes to teach important skills for running a startup.
Making and using robots to do tasks or solve problems.
The science of building and using robots to do jobs, especially ones humans find hard.
Robotics startups are supported under iStart as part of the innovation-driven tech sector. They may receive R&D support, incubation, mentorship, and access to labs or testing facilities.
Special labs and expert help for startups making robots or automated systems.
The top leader of a company who makes the big decisions.
The top boss who runs and manages a company.
The CEO of a startup plays a critical role in driving the vision and growth. iStart supports startup leadership through mentoring, leadership training, and CEO networking opportunities.
Training programs to help startup leaders become better bosses.
Using text, images, video, sound, and animation together to share ideas or stories.
Using a mix of video, images, sound, and text to present something engagingly.
Multimedia startups—working in video, design, content creation, and digital media—can access support under iStart, especially if their work aligns with AVGC or creative tech sectors.
Support for startups making videos, graphics, and creative digital content.
Computer-made effects are used in movies or games to show things that can’t be filmed in real life.
Special effects are added to movies or videos using computers to create magic or action scenes.
iStart encourages startups in the VFX (Visual Effects) industry under the broader AVGC-XR category, providing specialized incubation, infrastructure, and market linkages.
High-tech equipment and training for startups making movie-style visual effects.
Storing and using data or apps online instead of on your computer.
A way to store data or run software online so you can use it from anywhere.
Cloud-based startups or those leveraging cloud infrastructure are supported in terms of tech mentorship and access to cloud credits or partnerships with platforms like AWS, Azure, etc.
Help with online technology and free credits to use cloud services.
MSME is short for Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprise. Small businesses that run with limited money and staff.
A small-scale business that works with limited money, staff, or resources.
iStart works closely with MSMEs by helping them innovate, digitize, and scale. Registered startups that qualify as MSMEs can access both startup and MSME benefits.
Support for small businesses to grow and get benefits from both startup and MSME schemes.
Big spaces with storage, transport, and delivery facilities to help move goods faster and cheaper.
Large centers where goods are stored, packed, and shipped efficiently for delivery.
Logistics and supply chain startups may benefit from government infrastructure, such as logistics parks and transport hubs, being developed in Rajasthan to support commerce and e-commerce.
Special places with good facilities to help startups store and ship their products easily.
